clauses.title: Captioning playback

findings.description: Caption track detected via <track kind="captions"> element with WebVTT source.

clauses.recommendation: Captions are present and playable. Ensure captions are available in all languages offered for the content.

clauses.title: Caption synchronization

findings.description: Caption timestamps are present in WebVTT file but synchronization accuracy could not be fully verified automatically.
findings.evidence: WebVTT cues found: 342 cues, average gap between cues: 2.1s

clauses.recommendation: Manual verification recommended: spot-check caption timing against spoken dialogue at multiple points in the content.

clauses.title: Caption characteristics

findings.description: Video player does not provide user controls for caption font size, color, or background opacity.
findings.evidence: No caption customization UI elements detected in player controls.

clauses.recommendation: Add caption appearance settings to the player UI. Users must be able to adjust font size, font color, background color, and opacity. Reference: BBC iPlayer and Netflix provide good examples of caption customization controls.

clauses.title: Audio description playback

findings.description: No audio description track detected in the HLS manifest or via <track kind="descriptions"> element.
findings.evidence: HLS manifest parsed: 3 audio tracks found (English, German, French) — none marked as audio description.

clauses.recommendation: Add an audio description track to the content. Include it as an alternative audio rendition in the HLS manifest with GROUP-ID indicating audio description. The player must provide a mechanism for users to select this track.

clauses.title: User controls for captions and audio description

findings.description: Caption toggle button is present but is nested inside a submenu, not at the same interaction level as play/pause controls.
findings.evidence: Caption toggle requires: click settings gear → click 'Subtitles' → select language (3 interactions vs 1 for play/pause).

clauses.recommendation: Move the caption toggle to the primary control bar so it is accessible at the same interaction level as play, pause, and volume controls. EN 301 549 requires caption/AD controls to be at the same level as primary media controls.

clauses.title: Non-text content

findings.description: 3 images found without alternative text attributes.

clauses.recommendation: Add descriptive alt attributes to all images. For decorative images, use alt="". For informative images, describe the content or function of the image.

findings.description: Page uses semantic HTML: headings are properly nested, lists use <ul>/<ol>, and form elements have associated labels.
All text elements meet the minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for normal text and 3:1 for large text.
findings.evidence: Lowest contrast ratio found: 5.2:1 on navigation link text (#555 on #fff).

findings.description: All interactive elements on the page are reachable and operable via keyboard.
Tab order follows a logical reading sequence through navigation, main content, and footer.
Focus indicators are visible on all interactive elements when navigating with keyboard.
Page has lang attribute set on the <html> element.

clauses.title: Parsing

findings.description: 2 HTML validation warnings detected that may affect assistive technology interpretation.
findings.evidence: Duplicate id="player-container" found on lines 34 and 89.

clauses.recommendation: Fix duplicate ID attributes. Each id value must be unique within the document to ensure assistive technologies can correctly reference elements.

clauses.title: Name, role, value

findings.description: Video player control buttons lack accessible names. Screen readers announce them as 'button' with no indication of function.
findings.evidence: <button class="player-btn play"><svg>...</svg></button> — no aria-label, no visible text, no title attribute.

clauses.recommendation: Add aria-label attributes to all player control buttons. For example: aria-label="Play", aria-label="Pause", aria-label="Volume", aria-label="Fullscreen". Ensure labels update dynamically (e.g., 'Play' becomes 'Pause' when playing).
